intro: Astragalus susianus subsp. sericeus, commonly known as the silky milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its silky,绢-like foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
